website_summaries.verdict: The overall feedback for the Saucony Mad River TR has been positive. People are generally happy with what this trail running shoe has to offer. The lightweight build and the versatile outsole construction are highlighted as the elements that elevated this product to the realm of agreeable user-friendliness. Also, the slip-on structure apparently worked with the nonrestrictive lacing system to properly keep the foot in place.Fans of neutral running shoes that are for the unpredictable terrains are the target market of the Saucony Mad River TR.
pros: Some people claim that for a trail running shoe, the Saucony Mad River TR is light enough for all-day wear
The platform is deemed sufficiently flexible by a few testers who like the natural movement of the foot to be encouraged
Several consumers have stated that the trail-ready outsole of this Saucony running shoe isn’t too aggressive to remove efficacy on flat surfaces
A couple of runners wrote that the underfoot cushioning system is able to provide comfort throughout the running session
The one-piece opening of the Mad River TR is lauded by those who welcome a quick in-and-out experience when wearing a shoe
The choice of wide and close-fitting lacing methods on the roof of the upper is praised by those who like some customization for the fit-adjustment
cons: A tester has complained that the platform isn’t as supportive as advertised, that the underfoot experience is flat
The sidewall-like raised portions of the midsole are criticized for putting some pressure against the skin of the foot

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and support
customer_reviews.text: Took these out for the first time on a local run in the neighborhood - mostly asphalt, but some dirt roads. Comfortable, good support. Looking forward to my 1/2 marathon trail run in November. Love the options for lacing, as well as the option to add traction via screws into the bottom - which I will try when the ice comes to Michigan. This is my first pair of trail shoes, but if this is what I can expect from Saucony's trail shoes - I will be buying many more!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hansel

customer_reviews.title: Superb very unSaucony like roominess
customer_reviews.text: Finally! A roomy toe box! I saw these being marketed as wide toe box for proper toe splay and was really impressed that they have a near foot shape almost like a Topo shoe but not ridiculously wide like an Altra. This is helpful not just for toe comfort but for stability on trails where you may roll an ankle. I personally bought these for work use in a hospital. I am also an avid runner and will likely get another pair for trail/road running as these will be great for any surface. Saucony, please stop making pointy elf shoes and make more road versions ie Ride ISO like this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Zoomzoom

customer_reviews.title: seems fine
customer_reviews.text: I have never tried this type of shoe before (stretchy, more fitted). I think I will like not having my foot move around in shoe as much. Adequate trail performance (up/downhill, rocky, roots, spots of mud). I considered going with the 9.5 since my toe was so close to the end of the shoe; however, I discovered that the price of the shoe had gone up $30 in two days so scrapped that plan. Would pay $79 for this utilitarian footwear, but $109 is edging toward a price for a better shoe.
customer_reviews.author: eskimodoc

customer_reviews.title: Another great pair!!
customer_reviews.text: Replacing my 4 year old pair. Shoes from Saucony always fit perfectly And these are not exceptions. The sole is pretty aggressive and should provide some real good traction on loose, even wet surfaces. The sole material is kind of soft so I wonder for how long they stay in shape, though. The shoe laces are pretty long and I am going to try the second lace option. The graphic is awesome and I am going to wear these with a white+grey camo shirt from Amazon Basic.
customer_reviews.author: mk

customer_reviews.title: Lots of good things going for it, but long
customer_reviews.text: I really loved a lot of things about this shoe -- wide toe box, reasonably low to the ground, and a protective sole. When I first put them on I thought they might be perfect. Unfortunately, they are notably long, and the wide toe box is actually a bit too roomy. That left too much material at the front of the shoe, especially on the outer side of the foot and my foot would slide a bit inside the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: HoiPolloi

customer_reviews.title: As close to perfect as it gets
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a phenomenal shoe overall. Typically wear a 10 but the 9.5 formed snug to my foot. Durability is 10/10 and style is 8/10. Has long shoe strings and 2 different sets of holes in case you have a wide foot. I use these shoes for everything, like trail running, hiking, biking and i also wear them at work (i work at a restaurant for 10+ hours/day). Bought 2 pairs because i was so blown away with the design and variety of usage
customer_reviews.author: Caesar

customer_reviews.title: Great trail running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best shoes I have run in! Great for the trail with lots of traction. I usually have issues fitting into running shoes because of wide feet. But I followed advise online "buy one size bigger than your dress shoes", my dress shoe size is 10.5 us and I bought 11.5 running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: finikera

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good shoe. Great for trail walking or any type of outdoor activity. I've used saucony's for a long time. To fit and finish a very good. They fit perfectly for my size. They are true to size. They should last me a long time without any issues. Traction seems very good so far for the past few days of wearing them. I got the blue color ones and I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and customizable
customer_reviews.text: Using for trail running. The comfort level is on par with my road shoes. I bought these because they most seemed like the Kinvara series but for trails. Nice and cushiony and very comfortable upper. The lack of a tongue is very nice as well. The lacing arrangement can be customized to almost anything you can think of because it has two sets of eyelets. Nice shoe overall.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Really really needs some sort of rock protection
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great shoe if it had any sort of rock protection. You can feel every single rock no matter how small. I am all on board with road feel, but this is too much road feel. So if you run on trails that have rocks, this shoe may not be for you. My Altra Escalante has more protection than this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Watch Collector

customer_reviews.title: Snow and ice doesn’t stand a chance!
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe! Great for trail and snow running. I don’t do much trail running but i run a lot in the snow and ice. This show is awesome for the ice because of the screws... and it does great in the snow because Of the tread. It gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking trail shoes I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: Just took these shoes on a 13 mile hike up in the mountains and it was so comfortable on the trail due to it being so light and airy and great cushion. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alekhine Sabalo

customer_reviews.title: Great value for good trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of the Mad River Tr. I’m not in love with the white Camo color, but they live on the trail, so color isn’t my priority. Fit is perfect size 10, roomy toe-box, good heel fit.
customer_reviews.author: Penn7

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I just received the shoes a week ago, so have only run with them a few times. I like room at the toe, as that is a problem for a lot of running/trail shoes. So a big plus there. The laces could be switched out for ones that stay tied, but that’s a minor issue. So far so good, I like the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: robert j lamendola

customer_reviews.title: Try a pair, its worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking shoe. Im usually a Nike guy, but these look cool. Comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid trainers.
customer_reviews.text: The price was good to try. Even at normal price these are great. I am a heavier runner and needed something for the upcoming rain and slippery trails. Shoe was on the heavy side but lock down was nice with the Gusseted tongue. I think that added weight but worth it to avoid needing gators.
customer_reviews.author: irod1988

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: Brand new in the box. I read a few reviews that claimed they were sent used shoes. Not to sound corny but they are awesome. I have been wearing Saucony shoes for over 10 years. I am excited to put some miles on these.
customer_reviews.author: Saddi1

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Solid fit, very lightweight, and I love how the tongue is attached to the shoes itself. So far I really like these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've taken up "running" during the pandemic. I needed some new shoes. I've ordered and returned a few other pairs of shoes. I'm keeping these. They are comfortable and nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shoe. A must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this shoe! True to size and handles well on the trails. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: They are great...Saucony if you read this, please make this same exact shoe in an approach/hiking shoe with stiffer sole and beefed up upper ... these are optimal for concrete or flat dirt, they breath like no other and are solidly built as far as I have seen so far.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Siegfried

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes. Fit as expected. Very comfortable and light. The outsole has awesome tread design. Very grippy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Melton

customer_reviews.title: Inner material wearing out.
customer_reviews.text: Only after owning the shoes approximately 2 months the inner fabric on each heel is wearing out. I should have trusted my gut when I opened the shoes the day I received them and returned the shoes. They didn't look or feel like solid trail running shoes...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Namba

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Not too heavy, good cushion, good grip on all sorts of trails and a great price. Great value
customer_reviews.author: Dmitri Skiba

customer_reviews.title: Love this Shoe!!!
customer_reviews.text: Completely happy with this show. Comfortable and great tread for trailing running. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chris White

customer_reviews.title: The best trail running so far!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best trail running shoes ever. Decent price and fits perfect. I have tired many other companies but this has to be one of the best. A runners delight!
customer_reviews.author: Yonten

customer_reviews.title: Shoes damaged after few use.
customer_reviews.text: Only after few running with this shoes its started to damage inside the shoes. See pictures. I can't use it because it will wound my legs. It's happened in a middle of marathon and I lost this marathon because my legs wound.
customer_reviews.author: Yaniv E.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and Traction
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for trail running. 8 miler right out of the box, no hot spots or blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Took them out of the box and starting hiking 5-10 miles right away. Very comfortable from day one, no breaking in necessary. The waterproof seal around the bottom keeps the feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Willis

customer_reviews.title: These sneakers are great.
customer_reviews.text: Love the sneakers very comfortable and great for running. Love the color I made a great investment on this purchase. These brand of sneakers will be my brand for life the u very much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ride
customer_reviews.text: One of my all-time favorite running shoes. I wear thru most soles way too fast but these are holding up nicely. Like the crystal rubber very much.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable shoes. The fit is perfect and they have a lot of support, perfect for daily use if you walk alot. I haven't been using them for running.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: Wouldnt have any other brand of running shoe. Saucony is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: Soft running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very soft running shoes. Got them wet and the vent holes helped wick the wet away
customer_reviews.author: danny

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been disappointed by Saucony, great shoes, should’ve buy a spare pair to keep on ice
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL FILICE

customer_reviews.title: I have no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Its too early to tell about the durability but everything else was just right.
customer_reviews.author: Randall C.

customer_reviews.title: Used them for golf
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. I use them on the golf course and they gripped well.
customer_reviews.author: TD

product_meta.title: Saucony mens Mad River TR Mad River Tr
product_meta.description: Embark on your next trail-running adventure with the Saucony™ Mad River TR shoes. Predecessor: None. Pronation: Neutral. Cushioning: Responsive. Surface: Trail/Grass. Heel Stack Height: 23mm. Forefoot Stack Height: 19mm. Offset: 4mm. Durable upper provides enhanced protection in high-abrasion areas. EVERUN™ topsole supplies heightened energy return and lasting cushioning. Natural foot shape promotes a wide toe splay for increased stability and power transfer. Padded collar and integrated tongue keeps debris out. Gaiter-compatible D-Ring allows the option for adding extra protection. Tongue and heel pull for easy on and off. Traditional lace-up closure with an elastic lace keeper to hold the laces out the way. PWRFOAM midsole provides increased cushioning for ultimate comfort. PWRTRAC tacky, durable-rubber outsole provides enhanced traction and abrasion resistance. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 11 oz Product measurements were taken using size 9, width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: The PWRFOAM midsole and EVERUN topsole work together to provide underfoot cushioning
PWRTRAC tacky rubber, combined with a dual compound outsole, and rugged directional lugs give you confidence on any surface
Two rows of eyelets provide endless lace configurations
Integrated tongue helps keep debris out and has a gaiter-compatible D Ring to give the option of adding extra protection
